      • get

        public Entity get(java.lang.String site,
         java.lang.String id)
           throws StanbolServiceException
        Description copied from interface: StanbolEntityhubService
        This service searches the referenced site passed by parameter for the entity with the passed URI. If the site parameter is null or doesn't exist as ReferencedSite, the service would search the entity over all referenced sites configured in Stanbol. If the requested entity can not be found a null object is returned.
        Specified by:
        get in interface StanbolEntityhubService
        Parameters:
        site - Referenced Site to search. If null or not exist, all referenced sites will be used
        id - Entity's URI
        Returns:
        Throws:
        StanbolServiceException
        See Also:
        StanbolEntityhubService.get(String, String)

      • create

        public java.lang.String create(java.io.InputStream is,
                      java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.Boolean update)
                        throws StanbolServiceException
        Description copied from interface: StanbolEntityhubService
        Create entities in the EntityHub. If any of such Entities already exists within the Entityhub and the update parameter is false, a StanbolServiceException will be thrown
        Specified by:
        create in interface StanbolEntityhubService
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream containing entities' RDF data
        id - URI of the entity. If the URI is null, RDF entities' ids will be used. If the URI is not null, only the referenced entity will be created or updated
        update - If true, entities that already exist will be updated
        Returns:
        URI of the created Entity.
        Throws:
        StanbolServiceException
        See Also:

      • lookup

        public Entity lookup(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.Boolean create)
              throws StanbolServiceException
        Description copied from interface: StanbolEntityhubService
        This service looks-up Symbols (Entities managed by the Entityhub) based on the passed URI. The passed ID can be the URI of a Symbol or an Entity of any referenced site. If the passed ID is a String of a Symbol, then the stored information of the Symbol are returned If the passed ID is an URI of an already mapped entity, then the existing mapping is used to get the according Symbol. If "create" is enabled, and the passed URI is not already mapped to a Symbol, than all the currently active referenced sites are searched for an Entity with the passed URI. If the configuration of the referenced site allows to create new symbols, then the entity is imported in the Entityhub, a new Symbol and EntityMapping is created and the newly created Symbol is returned. In case the entity is not found (this also includes if the entity would be available via a referenced site, but create=false) a null object is returned. In case the entity is found on a referenced site, but the creation of a new Symbol is not allowed a StanbolServiceException is thrown
        Specified by:
        lookup in interface StanbolEntityhubService
        Parameters:
        id - URI of the Entity/Symbol/ReferencedSite
        create - If true, a new symbol is created if necessary and allowed
        Returns:
        Throws:
        StanbolServiceException
        See Also:
        StanbolEntityhubService.lookup(String, Boolean)

      • search

        public java.util.List<Entity> search(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String field,
                            java.lang.String language,
                            LDPathProgram ldpath,
                            int limit,
                            int offset)
                              throws StanbolServiceException
        Description copied from interface: StanbolEntityhubService
        Find locally managed Entities by label based search
        Specified by:
        search in interface StanbolEntityhubService
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Entity to search. Supports '*' and '?
        field - The name of the field to search the name. Optional, default is rdfs:label
        language - The language of the parsed name (default: any)
        ldpath - The LDPath program executed for entities selected by the find query (optionally). The LDPath program needs to be URLEncoded.
        limit - The maximum number of returned Entities (optional)
        offset - The offset of the first returned Entity (default: 0)
        Returns:
        List of finded entities
        Throws:
        StanbolServiceException
        See Also:
        StanbolEntityhubService#search(String, String, String, String, int, int)

      • search

        public java.util.List<Entity> search(java.lang.String site,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String field,
                            java.lang.String language,
                            LDPathProgram ldpath,
                            int limit,
                            int offset)
                              throws StanbolServiceException
        Description copied from interface: StanbolEntityhubService
        Find ReferencedSite managed Entities by label based search
        Specified by:
        search in interface StanbolEntityhubService
        Parameters:
        site - Referenced Site to search. If null or not exist, all referenced sites will be used
        name - The name of the Entity to search. Supports '*' and '?
        field - The name of the field to search the name. Optional, default is rdfs:label
        language - The language of the parsed name (default: any)
        ldpath - The LDPath program executed for entities selected by the find query (optionally). The LDPath program needs to be URLEncoded.
        limit - The maximum number of returned Entities (optional)
        offset - The offset of the first returned Entity (default: 0)
        Returns:
        List of finded entities
        Throws:
        StanbolServiceException
        See Also:
        StanbolEntityhubService#search(String, String, String, String, String, int, int)

                                     LDPathProgram ldPathProgram)
                                       throws StanbolServiceException

        Allows to execute an LDPath program on one or more Entities (contexts)
        Specified by:
        ldpath in interface StanbolEntityhubService
        Parameters:

        ldPathProgram - The LDPath program to execute
